title: Do Not Feed The Clowns
description: A woman is plagued by a deep and debilitating fear of clowns. Frustrated by the lack of competence and personal authenticity in those around her, she struggles to come to terms with her condition in the face of obstacles presented at work, at home and by her friends. She finally enrols in a revealing course of psychotherapy in a desperate attempt to find peace and a resolution to her condition. This is a book full of existential anxt and social observation. If you enjoy having your nose rubbed in alegory - its for you.And who exactly are the clowns? Iâ€™ll leave you to decide.
author: Buck Starmer
